image.altText: Three day measles infection

props.synopsis: Health authorities have issued a second measles alert for a range of locations in Adelaide after a teenager tested positive.

title.children: SA Health releases exposure sites after teenager tests positive to measles

image.altText: Malls Balls in Rundle Mall.

props.synopsis: A police crackdown in Adelaide's CBD has netted 48 people for shoplifting offences and recovered about $7,000 worth of allegedly stolen items in a single day.

title.children: Dozens arrested or reported in one day during shoplifting sting in Adelaide's CBD

image.altText: Gather Round

props.synopsis: The football begins tonight night when the Crows take on Melbourne, with Adelaide desperate for its first win.

title.children: 'It brings an energy, it brings an enthusiasm': Adelaide buzzing as AFL Gather Round kicks off with more than 200,000 tickets sold

image.altText: A man with blue scrubs holding a blood pressure band

props.synopsis: An enrolled mental health nurse who obtained phone numbers and began intimate personal relationships with two patients has been banned from the providing any health service for five years.

title.children: Mental health nurse banned for inappropriate patient relationships

image.altText: Smokes rises from a truck crash site.

props.synopsis: The Eyre Highway is closed as emergency services respond to reports of a serious crash involving two trucks near Yalata.

title.children: Major highway in SA closed until Friday after serious truck crash

image.altText: A man in a suit arrives at the federal court in sydney surrounded by journalists and cameras

props.synopsis: The defamation case brought by Bruce Lehrmann against Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson is reopening today to hear fresh evidence from former Seven Network producer Taylor Auerbach.

title.children: Former Seven Network producer Taylor Auerbach testifies in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Court is formally adjourned until tomorrow
Auerbach concedes he only saw invoices from Lehrmann, but no payment record
Auerbach denies trying to 'destroy' those connected to Seven

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann speaks to 7NEWS Spotlight in an interview.

props.synopsis: The Seven Network has begun responding to allegations by a former producer about their pursuit of the former Liberal staffer in the Federal Court.

title.children: 'Beggars belief': Questions over Seven Network's single document detailing discussions with Bruce Lehrmann

image.altText: A large car with a large hole blown in the top of it

props.synopsis: José Andrés says an attack that killed seven humanitarian aid workers in Gaza targeted them "systematically, car by car".

title.children: World Central Kitchen founder says Israel targeted his aid workers 'systematically, car by car'

image.altText: Albanese gestures with a pointed finger on the floor of the lower house.

props.synopsis: The prime minister says it "isn't good enough" for Israel to dismiss as an accident an air strike that killed seven aid workers, including one Australian, calling for the investigation to be made public on its completion.

title.children: Albanese demands Israel make public investigation into air strike that killed aid workers

image.altText: A close up of a woman holding a fringe bag wearing an orange shawl and pants.

props.synopsis: Australians in Bali for holidays have been left confused by a new $15 tourism tax and efforts by police to enforce payment.

title.children: Fed up with badly behaved tourists and obnoxious influencers, Bali has a new tax and a new list of rules

image.altText: A group of men in suits stand for an official photo smiling at the camera in front of a wooden display cabinet

props.synopsis: The visit comes ahead of a critical meeting of Pacific leaders later this year, with officials seeing the meeting as yet another sign that China is intent on pushing its presence in the region.

title.children: China sends police delegation to 'assist' Tonga after Australia says it should have 'no role'

image.altText: A malleefowl

props.synopsis: A Nature Foundation fundraising campaign that received two donations of $100,000 from generous professors enables it to buy a 200-hectare property home to malleefowl and other rare species in south-east South Australia.

title.children: Bird-loving professors instrumental in $390k purchase of cattle property to protect endangered native species

image.altText: A white ute in a dense forrest next to a creek. The grass around it has been flattened by water.

props.synopsis: A man has died after his vehicle became submerged in floodwaters at Greenbank, south of Brisbane.

title.children: Grandfather who died in floodwaters identified, as more than 100mm of rain falls in an hour in south-east Queensland

image.altText: A weather map showing heavy rain forecast over eastern Australia.

props.synopsis: Sydney is on flood watch alongside at least 30 rivers across NSW and Queensland as torrential rain is expected to pummel eastern Australia over the next 48 hours.

title.children: Major rain event engulfing most of eastern Australia for next 48 hours as BOM issues flood warning

image.altText: A smiling Indian woman hair tied, looped over shoulder, red and white printed shirt, glasses, red lipstick, smiles at camera.

props.synopsis: Women's health specialists say gender bias in rebates for medical procedures is costing women more money and disincentivising women's health practitioners.

title.children: Gender inequity 'baked into the system' for Medicare rebates, doctors' group says

image.altText: A glass mug of cranberry juice with cranberries scattered around it. The outstretched palm of a hand also holds cranberries.

props.synopsis: You may have been told by a family member or a friend to drink cranberry juice if you've ever found yourself suffering with the uncomfortable symptoms of a UTI. But, does it work?

title.children: Is cranberry juice an effective treatment option for urinary tract infections?

image.altText: A woman in a World Central Kitchen shirt smiles at the camera standing in a cafe

props.synopsis: There have been "tipping points" since the war in Gaza began nearly six months ago. But this week's deadly Israeli air strike on an aid convoy may prove to be one of the most significant — and on one side of Australian politics, the response has been fury.

title.children: As Albanese tips into outrage over the death of an Australian aid worker in an Israeli air strike, Dutton remains unmoved

image.altText: Australian Tax Office

props.synopsis: Small business owners have collected billions of dollars in GST from their customers in recent years but failed to hand it to the tax office, prompting a warning from the new tax commissioner.

title.children: Has the GST you've paid actually gone to the government? The billions owed to the ATO suggests a lot hasn't

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Juan Vicente Pérez Mora surrounded by people in facemasks.

props.synopsis: Juan Vicente Pérez Mora, who was a month away from his 115th birthday, is history's fourth oldest male whose age has been officially ratified.

title.children: The world's oldest living man, who attributes health to daily nip of liquor, dies aged 114

image.altText: A woman in a blue dress sitting in a wheelchair in her home.

props.synopsis: Qantas has been slammed over its treatment of a woman with disability who was trying to get from Perth to Canberra for a work trip.

title.children: 'Unacceptable and appalling': Qantas charged Anwen $6.4k for business seats because economy wasn't accessible

image.altText: A couple outside their home in western Sydney.

props.synopsis: It was supposed to be the end of the "property cyclone", but more builders are going under, new home builds are declining and consumers are left fighting to fix defects in newly constructed houses and apartments.

title.children: 'When the cash flow stops, they go bust': More builders are collapsing and consumers are fighting to fix their homes

image.altText: A woman looks across a soccer ground towards a set of changerooms set up on a hill

props.synopsis: The Women's World Cup inspired record registrations for women and girls in football. But clubs are struggling to find the fields to fit them all.

title.children: The Matildas have inspired record sign-ups for women and girls, but where will clubs fit them?

image.altText: Two people, a man and a woman, sit in an ornate room

props.synopsis: Scoop promises to tell the story of the days leading up to the interview that all but ruined Prince Andrew's reputation.

title.children: Prince Andrew's disastrous interview is only 'five per cent' of the story. Scoop tells the rest

image.altText: Yolande dressed as Cleop[atra with a group of people in fancy dress

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has uncovered the details in material promoting Mr Entsch's wife Yolonde as the LNP candidate for the state seat of Cairns.

title.children: Federal MP 'delivered' multi-million-dollar contract to company that hired his wife to run 'character building' craft workshops

image.altText: Alice voxxie thumbnail

props.synopsis: As the two-week youth curfew in Alice Springs hits the halfway point, here's what locals think about the measure.

title.children: One week into a youth curfew, what do Alice Springs locals think?

image.altText: A film photograph of a young woman wearing a RAAF uniform and smiling.

props.synopsis: Newcastle man Peter John Wetzler will seek court costs after a murder charge was struck out in relation to the disappearance of his fiancee 40 years ago.

title.children: NSW man to seek costs from Victoria Police after cold case murder charge against him is dropped

image.altText: Against a white background a hand holds a smartphone by thumb and index finger, hanging from up high.

props.synopsis: Finding it hard to stop scrolling? These experts recommend simple changes to the way you use your smartphone to cultivate a healthier relationship with it.

title.children: Your smartphone is doing you damage — but getting rid of it might not be the answer

image.altText: A sparse, concrete warehouse with a few shelves, and a forklift.

props.synopsis: Beebird Logistics has provided a direct mail service between Australia and China for years. However, the company is currently plagued by months-long delays, with parcels missing for almost half a year.

title.children: When a courier company vanished, all signs pointed to one address. But what the ABC found was an empty warehouse

image.altText: A young man with dark hair, a beard, a suit and glasses walks on the street.

props.synopsis: Television news and current affairs in Australia has traditionally been a competitive pursuit, so it's no surprise that two television networks have been caught up in the response to one of the most notorious criminal allegations in recent Australian history.

title.children: Two major news networks now embroiled in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation action

image.altText: Fox standing in green grass.

props.synopsis: Australian farmers, and native fauna, have been in a losing fight against foxes for more than 150 years and while bounty hunters have been busy, there is still no end in sight.

title.children: After 150 years of a seemingly 'never-ending' battle, is the eradication of foxes from Australia even possible?

image.altText: Firefighters complete their mission and evacuate from the collapsed building after a quake.

props.synopsis: Search and rescue mission continues after the earthquake led to collapsed buildings and landslides in Taiwan.

title.children: Rescue efforts continue after nine killed and hundreds injured in Taiwan's biggest earthquake in 25 years

props.synopsis: Police arrested the pair after setting up a strike force to investigate the death of the two-year-old boy, who was taken to hospital with significant head injuries.

title.children: Man and woman from NSW Riverina charged with manslaughter over toddler's death

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A small gain on Wall Street sends Australian stocks higher, while fresh building approvals data showed a massive plunge in apartment approvals, which is worrying for both builders and city-dwelling renters. See how the day unfolded on our live business blog.

title.children: ASX rises, former RBA boss laments unproductive tax system, while apartment approvals plunge — as it happened

image.altText: Colourful graphic featuring two teen girls in school uniform and a hand placing a piece of paper into a ballot box.

props.synopsis: Sixteen-year-olds can learn to drive, get a job, pay taxes and be on the Organ Donor Register, but they are considered too young to vote. Should they also have a stake in deciding their future?

title.children: Stella and Jayla want to have a say in the future of this country. But the law doesn't allow them

image.altText: Drone image of Elcho Island.

props.synopsis: The NT remote community of Galiwin'ku has been without Telstra mobile phone reception for 12 consecutive nights, leading local Yolŋu families to question what they "have done to be treated like this".

title.children: 'Completely abandoned': Remote NT community without Telstra coverage for 12 consecutive nights
